greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least k such that the remainder when 9^k is divided by k is n.
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 with -1 for large entries where a(n) has not yet been found, Nov 21 2016 [With 202 new terms, this supersedes an earlier table of Robert G. Wilson v et al.]
example: For n=4, since 9^5 == 4 (mod 5) and 9^k is not congruent to 4 (mod k) for any k < 5, a(4) = 5. _Michael B. Porter_, Dec 10 2016
maple: a127817 := [seq(0,j=1..nmax)] ; for k from 1 do n := modp(9^k,k) ; if n > 0 and n <= nmax then if op(n,a127817) = 0 then a127817 := subsop(n=k,a127817) ; print( op(1..50,a127817) ) ; fi; fi; od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 16 2009
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jan 30 2007
